id="content"><header id="content-head"><div class="row clearfix"><div class="col-xs-9"><h1>Payment Flows</h1></div></div></header><div class="grid-container-fluid" id="content-container"><section class="content-body grid-75"><div dehydrated="<p>Payper&#x27;s API provides multiple payment flow options for customers to complete their transaction. This document outlines the various options available when integrating this payment method with your application or checkout process and best practices for each integration option. </p>
<ol>
<li>Pop-up Bank Selector</li>
<li>In-flow Bank Selector</li>
<li>Button To Bank Selector</li>
<li>Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended) </li>
</ol>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-1-pop-up-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-1-pop-up-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 1: Pop-up Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 1: Pop-up Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-1-pop-up-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview"></a></h3>
<p>With this integration method the a new browser pop-up window is opened in the users browser allowing them to select the bank they wish to use to complete the payment.</p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow4.html" width="700" height="500" frameBorder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bank_payment_url</code> field which contains a URL to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>A popup should open in the users browser and load the URL from the API response. </li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="handling-browser-pop-up-blocking"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-handling-browser-pop-up-blocking" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Handling Browser Pop-up Blocking</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Handling Browser Pop-up Blocking" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#handling-browser-pop-up-blocking"></a></h3>
<p>To avoid the permission popup from opening the popup,  avoid calling <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">window.open</code> in a function that returns a promise or in callbacks for functions like <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">setTimeout</code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">setInterval</code>, or any other async function. This is because a popup can only be opened from an app without permission with direct user action.  Therefore, we should call <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">window.open</code> within synchronous functions run as a result of direct user action to avoid the popup permission popup from showing in any browser.</p>
<p>We can check if a popup is blocked by checking if <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">window.open</code> returns null or undefined.<br/>
For instance, we can check if a popup window is blocked by writing:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light" data-lang="javascript" name="" tabindex="0">const pop = (url, w, h) =&gt; {
  const popup = window.open(url, &#x27;_blank&#x27;, &#x27;toolbar=0,location=0,directories=0,status=1,menubar=0,titlebar=0,scrollbars=1,resizable=1,width=500,height=500&#x27;);
  return popup !== null &amp;&amp; typeof popup !== &#x27;undefined&#x27;
}
console.log(pop(&#x27;https://example.com&#x27;))
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>We call <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">window.open</code> with the url as the first argument and a string with some settings as the 3rd argument. Then we return is popup isnt null and popup isnt undefined. If the popup opens, then popup shouldnt be null and it shouldnt be undefined. And so the pop function should return true if the popup opens.</p>
<p>If the pop up does not open in the users browser, the checkout button which is returned in the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">message</code> field of the API response should be rendered to allow the customer to press it to continue the payment flow and open the popup window with the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">onClick</code> function.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-2-in-flow-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-2-in-flow-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 2: In-flow Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 2: In-flow Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-2-in-flow-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-1"></a></h3>
<p>The In-flow bank selector options allows you to render the bank selector component in the customer checkout flow directly, bypassing the eTransfer bank selector and taking the customer to their banking poral automatically. This method will also return the customers last used bank at the top of the bank selector component for convenience.</p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow3.html"  width="700" height="500" frameBorder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-1"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bank_selector_links</code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account they wish to use to complete the payment. </li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the online banking portal of the bank they selected.</li>
<li>User completes the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="optional-self-rendered-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-optional-self-rendered-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Optional Self Rendered Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Optional Self Rendered Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#optional-self-rendered-bank-selector"></a></h3>
<p>Payper also provides an option that allows the bank selector to be rendered dynamically in your application which allows control of the style and format of this component. </p>
<p>By calling the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">[List Available Banks](https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/eTransferBanks/)</code> endpoint Payper will return a JSON array of all the available banks supported by our network. A sample of this response is below:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0">{
  &quot;banks&quot;: [
    {
      &quot;bank_name&quot;: &quot;Synergy Credit Union&quot;,
      &quot;id&quot;: 346,
      &quot;institution_number&quot;: &quot;889&quot;,
      &quot;logo&quot;: &quot;https://online.synergycu.ca/Content/themes/SYN/images/custom/cu/logos/login.png?ver=108&quot;
    },
    {
      &quot;bank_name&quot;: &quot;TCU Financial Group&quot;,
      &quot;id&quot;: 347,
      &quot;institution_number&quot;: &quot;889&quot;,
      &quot;logo&quot;: &quot;https://www.tcufinancialgroup.com/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/Logo$v@202111080115.gif&quot;
    },
    {
      &quot;bank_name&quot;: &quot;Turtleford Credit Union&quot;,
      &quot;id&quot;: 348,
      &quot;institution_number&quot;: &quot;889&quot;,
      &quot;logo&quot;: &quot;https://www6.memberdirect.net/brand/sk_ceamscelero_turtleford/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/header/masthead/MastheadLogo$v@20211108010051.gif&quot;
    }
  ],
  &quot;errors&quot;: [],
  &quot;message&quot;: &quot;bank list retrieved successfully&quot;
}
</code></pre></div></div>
<p>With this response all of the required information such as Bank Name and Logo can be used to render the bank selector for the user dynamically. </p>
<p>When a request is made to the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">api/v2/payment/eTransfer/</code> endpoint simply provide the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bank_id</code> of the bank the users has selected in the response and the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">bank_payment_url</code> will contain the link to redirect the user to the appropriate banking portal to complete their payment. </p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-3-button-to-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-3-button-to-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 3: Button To Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 3: Button To Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-3-button-to-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-2"></a></h3>
<p>This integration method allows you to render a checkout button for users to click to complete the eTransfer transaction. When a user clicks on the checkout button, a pop-up opens to the eTransfer bank selector allowing the customer to complete their payment. </p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow2.html"  width="700" height="500" frameBorder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-2"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">message</code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User clicks the checkout button that is rendered. </li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 4: Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 4: Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-3"></a></h3>
<p>This integration method displays a message to the user to check their email inbox to complete the payment by opening the eTransfer email they received from Interac. Because this method requires the user to leave the current payment flow it is not recommended. </p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow1.html"  width="700" height="500" frameBorder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-3"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0">message</code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User checks their email client for an email from Interac and clicks on the link in the contents of the email to complete the payment.</li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.</li>
</ol>" class="rm-Markdown markdown-body rm-Markdown markdown-body ng-non-bindable" data-testid="RDMD" style="margin-left: 31px;"><p>Payper's API provides multiple payment flow options for customers to complete their transaction. This document outlines the various options available when integrating this payment method with your application or checkout process and best practices for each integration option. </p>
<ol>
<li>Pop-up Bank Selector</li>
<li>In-flow Bank Selector</li>
<li>Button To Bank Selector</li>
<li>Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended) </li>
</ol>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-1-pop-up-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-1-pop-up-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 1: Pop-up Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 1: Pop-up Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-1-pop-up-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview"></a></h3>
<p>With this integration method the a new browser pop-up window is opened in the users browser allowing them to select the bank they wish to use to complete the payment.</p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow4.html" width="700" height="500" frameborder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">bank_payment_url</span></code> field which contains a URL to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>A popup should open in the users browser and load the URL from the API response. </li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="handling-browser-pop-up-blocking"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-handling-browser-pop-up-blocking" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Handling Browser Pop-up Blocking</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Handling Browser Pop-up Blocking" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#handling-browser-pop-up-blocking"></a></h3>
<p>To avoid the permission popup from opening the popup,  avoid calling <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">window.open</span></code> in a function that returns a promise or in callbacks for functions like <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">setTimeout</span></code>, <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">setInterval</span></code>, or any other async function. This is because a popup can only be opened from an app without permission with direct user action.  Therefore, we should call <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">window.open</span></code> within synchronous functions run as a result of direct user action to avoid the popup permission popup from showing in any browser.</p>
<p>We can check if a popup is blocked by checking if <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">window.open</span></code> returns null or undefined.<br>
For instance, we can check if a popup window is blocked by writing:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JavaScript</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-javascript theme-light" data-lang="javascript" name="" tabindex="0"><div class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter"><span class="cm-keyword">const</span> <span class="cm-def">pop</span> <span class="cm-operator">=</span> (<span class="cm-def">url</span>, <span class="cm-def">w</span>, <span class="cm-def">h</span>) <span class="cm-operator">=></span> {
  <span class="cm-keyword">const</span> <span class="cm-def">popup</span> <span class="cm-operator">=</span> <span class="cm-variable">window</span>.<span class="cm-property">open</span>(<span class="cm-variable-2">url</span>, <span class="cm-string">'_blank'</span>, <span class="cm-string">'toolbar=0,location=0,directories=0,status=1,menubar=0,titlebar=0,scrollbars=1,resizable=1,width=500,height=500'</span>);
  <span class="cm-keyword">return</span> <span class="cm-variable-2">popup</span> <span class="cm-operator">!==</span> <span class="cm-atom">null</span> <span class="cm-operator">&&</span> <span class="cm-keyword">typeof</span> <span class="cm-variable-2">popup</span> <span class="cm-operator">!==</span> <span class="cm-string">'undefined'</span>
}
<span class="cm-variable">console</span>.<span class="cm-property">log</span>(<span class="cm-variable">pop</span>(<span class="cm-string">'https://example.com'</span>))
</div></code></pre></div></div>
<p>We call <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">window.open</span></code> with the url as the first argument and a string with some settings as the 3rd argument. Then we return is popup isnt null and popup isnt undefined. If the popup opens, then popup shouldnt be null and it shouldnt be undefined. And so the pop function should return true if the popup opens.</p>
<p>If the pop up does not open in the users browser, the checkout button which is returned in the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">message</span></code> field of the API response should be rendered to allow the customer to press it to continue the payment flow and open the popup window with the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">onClick</span></code> function.</p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-2-in-flow-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-2-in-flow-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 2: In-flow Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 2: In-flow Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-2-in-flow-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-1"></a></h3>
<p>The In-flow bank selector options allows you to render the bank selector component in the customer checkout flow directly, bypassing the eTransfer bank selector and taking the customer to their banking poral automatically. This method will also return the customers last used bank at the top of the bank selector component for convenience.</p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow3.html" width="700" height="500" frameborder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-1"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-1"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">bank_selector_links</span></code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account they wish to use to complete the payment. </li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the online banking portal of the bank they selected.</li>
<li>User completes the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="optional-self-rendered-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-optional-self-rendered-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Optional Self Rendered Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Optional Self Rendered Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#optional-self-rendered-bank-selector"></a></h3>
<p>Payper also provides an option that allows the bank selector to be rendered dynamically in your application which allows control of the style and format of this component. </p>
<p>By calling the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">[List Available Banks](https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/eTransferBanks/)</span></code> endpoint Payper will return a JSON array of all the available banks supported by our network. A sample of this response is below:</p>
<div class="CodeTabs CodeTabs_initial theme-light"><div class="CodeTabs-toolbar" role="tablist"><button aria-selected="true" class="CodeTabs_active" role="tab" type="button">JSON</button></div><div class="CodeTabs-inner" role="tabpanel"><pre><button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang-json theme-light" data-lang="json" name="" tabindex="0"><div class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">{
  <span class="cm-property">"banks"</span>: [
    {
      <span class="cm-property">"bank_name"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"Synergy Credit Union"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"id"</span>: <span class="cm-number">346</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"institution_number"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"889"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"logo"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"https://online.synergycu.ca/Content/themes/SYN/images/custom/cu/logos/login.png?ver=108"</span>
    },
    {
      <span class="cm-property">"bank_name"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"TCU Financial Group"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"id"</span>: <span class="cm-number">347</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"institution_number"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"889"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"logo"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"https://www.tcufinancialgroup.com/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/Logo$v@202111080115.gif"</span>
    },
    {
      <span class="cm-property">"bank_name"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"Turtleford Credit Union"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"id"</span>: <span class="cm-number">348</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"institution_number"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"889"</span>,
      <span class="cm-property">"logo"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"https://www6.memberdirect.net/brand/sk_ceamscelero_turtleford/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/header/masthead/MastheadLogo$v@20211108010051.gif"</span>
    }
  ],
  <span class="cm-property">"errors"</span>: [],
  <span class="cm-property">"message"</span>: <span class="cm-string">"bank list retrieved successfully"</span>
}
</div></code></pre></div></div>
<p>With this response all of the required information such as Bank Name and Logo can be used to render the bank selector for the user dynamically. </p>
<p>When a request is made to the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">api/v2/payment/eTransfer/</span></code> endpoint simply provide the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">bank_id</span></code> of the bank the users has selected in the response and the <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">bank_payment_url</span></code> will contain the link to redirect the user to the appropriate banking portal to complete their payment. </p>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-3-button-to-bank-selector"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-3-button-to-bank-selector" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 3: Button To Bank Selector</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 3: Button To Bank Selector" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-3-button-to-bank-selector"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-2"></a></h3>
<p>This integration method allows you to render a checkout button for users to click to complete the eTransfer transaction. When a user clicks on the checkout button, a pop-up opens to the eTransfer bank selector allowing the customer to complete their payment. </p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow2.html" width="700" height="500" frameborder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-2"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-2"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">message</span></code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User clicks the checkout button that is rendered. </li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user. </li>
</ol>
<h2 class="heading heading-2 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Option 4: Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Option 4: Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#option-4-check-email-prompt-not-recommended"></a></h2>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="overview-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-overview" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Overview</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Overview" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#overview-3"></a></h3>
<p>This integration method displays a message to the user to check their email inbox to complete the payment by opening the eTransfer email they received from Interac. Because this method requires the user to leave the current payment flow it is not recommended. </p>
<div class="rdmd-html"><iframe src="https://pflow.netlify.app/flow1.html" width="700" height="500" frameborder="0"></iframe></div>
<h3 class="heading heading-3 header-scroll" align=""><div class="heading-anchor anchor waypoint" id="payment-flow-steps-3"></div><div class="heading-text"><div id="section-payment-flow-steps" class="heading-anchor_backwardsCompatibility"></div>Payment Flow Steps</div><a aria-label="Skip link to Payment Flow Steps" class="heading-anchor-icon fa fa-anchor" href="#payment-flow-steps-3"></a></h3>
<ol>
<li>User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount. </li>
<li>Our API will respond with a <button aria-label="Copy Code" class="rdmd-code-copy fa"></button><code class="rdmd-code lang- theme-light" data-lang="" name="" tabindex="0"><span class="cm-s-neo" data-testid="SyntaxHighlighter">message</span></code> field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.</li>
<li>User checks their email client for an email from Interac and clicks on the link in the contents of the email to complete the payment.</li>
<li>Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.</li>
<li>User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction. </li>
<li>When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.</li>
</ol></div><div class="UpdatedAt"><p class="DateLine "><i class="icon icon-watch"></i>Updated about 3 years ago </p></div><hr class="NextStepsDivider"><nav aria-label="Pagination Controls" class="PaginationControlsjDYuqu8pBMUy rm-Pagination"><a class="PaginationControls-link254uPEbaP92i PaginationControls-link_left1G58BmNHDbVm" aria-label="Previous Page: Payment Process" href="/docs/1-1"><span class="PaginationControls-iconZbaZ3tgyhNmI icon-arrow-left2"></span><div class="PaginationControls-text3qEXHZU00znD PaginationControls-text_left3wBkn4C9R0W_">Payment Process</div></a><a class="PaginationControls-link254uPEbaP92i PaginationControls-link_right5lsfuICZqXYk" aria-label="Next Page: e-Transfer Payout" href="/docs/e-transfer-payout-1"><div class="PaginationControls-text3qEXHZU00znD PaginationControls-text_right3EIfWubgRVVP">e-Transfer Payout</div><span class="PaginationControls-iconZbaZ3tgyhNmI icon-arrow-right2"></span></a></nav></section><section class="content-toc grid-25"><nav><ul class="toc-list"><li><a class="tocHeader" href="#"><i class="icon icon-text-align-left"></i>Table of Contents</a></li><li class="toc-children"><ul>

Payment Flows

Payper's API provides multiple payment flow options for customers to complete their transaction. This document outlines the various options available when integrating this payment method with your application or checkout process and best practices for each integration option.

Pop-up Bank Selector
In-flow Bank Selector
Button To Bank Selector
Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)
Option 1: Pop-up Bank Selector
Overview

With this integration method the a new browser pop-up window is opened in the users browser allowing them to select the bank they wish to use to complete the payment.

Payment Flow Steps
User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.
An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount.
Our API will respond with a bank_payment_url field which contains a URL to the eTransfer bank selector page.
A popup should open in the users browser and load the URL from the API response.
User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction.
When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.
Handling Browser Pop-up Blocking

To avoid the permission popup from opening the popup, avoid calling window.open in a function that returns a promise or in callbacks for functions like setTimeout, setInterval, or any other async function. This is because a popup can only be opened from an app without permission with direct user action. Therefore, we should call window.open within synchronous functions run as a result of direct user action to avoid the popup permission popup from showing in any browser.

We can check if a popup is blocked by checking if window.open returns null or undefined.
For instance, we can check if a popup window is blocked by writing:

JavaScript
const pop = (url, w, h) => {
  const popup = window.open(url, '_blank', 'toolbar=0,location=0,directories=0,status=1,menubar=0,titlebar=0,scrollbars=1,resizable=1,width=500,height=500');
  return popup !== null && typeof popup !== 'undefined'
}
console.log(pop('https://example.com'))


We call window.open with the url as the first argument and a string with some settings as the 3rd argument. Then we return is popup isnt null and popup isnt undefined. If the popup opens, then popup shouldnt be null and it shouldnt be undefined. And so the pop function should return true if the popup opens.

If the pop up does not open in the users browser, the checkout button which is returned in the message field of the API response should be rendered to allow the customer to press it to continue the payment flow and open the popup window with the onClick function.

Option 2: In-flow Bank Selector
Overview

The In-flow bank selector options allows you to render the bank selector component in the customer checkout flow directly, bypassing the eTransfer bank selector and taking the customer to their banking poral automatically. This method will also return the customers last used bank at the top of the bank selector component for convenience.

Payment Flow Steps
User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.
An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount.
Our API will respond with a bank_selector_links field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.
User selects their bank account they wish to use to complete the payment.
Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the online banking portal of the bank they selected.
User completes the Request Money transaction.
When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.
Optional Self Rendered Bank Selector

Payper also provides an option that allows the bank selector to be rendered dynamically in your application which allows control of the style and format of this component.

By calling the [List Available Banks](https://pp.payper.ca/api/v2/eTransferBanks/) endpoint Payper will return a JSON array of all the available banks supported by our network. A sample of this response is below:

JSON
{
  "banks": [
    {
      "bank_name": "Synergy Credit Union",
      "id": 346,
      "institution_number": "889",
      "logo": "https://online.synergycu.ca/Content/themes/SYN/images/custom/cu/logos/login.png?ver=108"
    },
    {
      "bank_name": "TCU Financial Group",
      "id": 347,
      "institution_number": "889",
      "logo": "https://www.tcufinancialgroup.com/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/Logo$v@202111080115.gif"
    },
    {
      "bank_name": "Turtleford Credit Union",
      "id": 348,
      "institution_number": "889",
      "logo": "https://www6.memberdirect.net/brand/sk_ceamscelero_turtleford/DynamicContent/Resources/Images/header/masthead/MastheadLogo$v@20211108010051.gif"
    }
  ],
  "errors": [],
  "message": "bank list retrieved successfully"
}


With this response all of the required information such as Bank Name and Logo can be used to render the bank selector for the user dynamically.

When a request is made to the api/v2/payment/eTransfer/ endpoint simply provide the bank_id of the bank the users has selected in the response and the bank_payment_url will contain the link to redirect the user to the appropriate banking portal to complete their payment.

Option 3: Button To Bank Selector
Overview

This integration method allows you to render a checkout button for users to click to complete the eTransfer transaction. When a user clicks on the checkout button, a pop-up opens to the eTransfer bank selector allowing the customer to complete their payment.

Payment Flow Steps
User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.
An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount.
Our API will respond with a message field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.
User clicks the checkout button that is rendered.
Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.
User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction.
When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.
Option 4: Check Email Prompt (Not Recommended)
Overview

This integration method displays a message to the user to check their email inbox to complete the payment by opening the eTransfer email they received from Interac. Because this method requires the user to leave the current payment flow it is not recommended.

Payment Flow Steps
User selects eTransfer payment option in the checkout flow.
An API request is sent to our system with the required customer information and the transaction amount.
Our API will respond with a message field which contains the HTML that should be rendered to the user in the checkout flow.
User checks their email client for an email from Interac and clicks on the link in the contents of the email to complete the payment.
Pop-up opens in the users browser directly to the eTransfer bank selector page.
User selects their bank account, and approves the Request Money transaction.
When payment is approved, you will receive a webhook from the Payper system allowing you to confirm the transaction and display the transaction status to the user.
